results.adx_keywords: Student Loans;United States Politics and Government;Decisions and Verdicts;Appeals Courts (US);Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.byline: By Stacy Cowley and Alan Rappeport
results.title: Appeals Court Temporarily Halts Biden’s Student Debt Cancellation
results.abstract: A federal appeals court on Friday temporarily halted President Biden’s student debt relief plan, preventing the government from moving forward with the debt cancellation it had said could start as early as next week.

media.caption: President Joe Biden speaking about student loan forgiveness at Delaware State University on Friday in Dover.
media.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

results.title: Hurricane Roslyn to Hit Mexico as a Major Storm
results.abstract: Roslyn became a Category 4 hurricane on Saturday. Forecasters warned it could bring coastal flooding and dangerous winds to cities along the Pacific Coast.

media.caption: Roslyn is a Category 4 hurricane, forecast to reach the coast of west-central Mexico on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Subpoenas;Midterm Elections (2022);Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;United States Politics and Government;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Trump, Donald J;House Committee on the Judiciary;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.byline: By Charlie Savage and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump Could Harness Unresolved Legal Issues to Resist Jan. 6 Panel’s Subpoena
results.abstract: If the ex-president turns down the drama of testifying, his legal team could mount several constitutional and procedural arguments in court.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump’s legal team could also invoke executive privilege in an attempt to ward off the subpoena.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.title: Taylor Swift, Caught Between Yesterday and Tomorrow on ‘Midnights’
results.abstract: The singer-songwriter’s 10th studio album returns to the pop sound she left in 2019, and explores a familiar subject: how she is perceived, and how she perceives herself.

media.caption: Taylor Swift’s “Midnights” recalls the sound of “Lover,” the album she put out in 2019 before two surprise releases — “Folklore” and “Evermore” — in 2020.

results.adx_keywords: Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Recalls and Bans of Products;Ethylene Glycol;Food Contamination and Poisoning;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Poisoning and Poisons;Kidneys;World Health Organization;Indonesia;Haryana (India);Gambia
results.title: Here’s What to Know About the Cough Syrup Scandal
results.abstract: Tainted syrup from India may be connected to the deaths of dozens of children in Gambia, officials said. Indonesia banned cough syrup sales, though the link there is unclear.

media.caption: A notice at a pharmacy in Jakarta, Indonesia, on Thursday announcing that the sale of medicinal syrup had been halted.

results.adx_keywords: High Net Worth Individuals;Inheritance and Estate Taxes;internal-sub-only;Philanthropy;Content Type: Personal Profile;Engelhorn, Marlene;Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy;Patriotic Millionaires;Resource Generation;Austria;Amsterdam (Netherlands)
results.title: She’s Inheriting Millions. She Wants Her Wealth Taxed Away.
results.abstract: Marlene Engelhorn, 30, heir to a fortune, isn’t interested in philanthropy, believing it only perpetuates existing power dynamics. She’s calling for structural change to how the ultrarich are taxed.
org_facet: Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy

media.caption: “The dream scenario is I get taxed,” said Ms. Engelhorn, the co-founder of a group called Tax Me Now.
media.copyright: Mashid Mohadjerin for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Affordable Housing;Rent Control and Stabilization;Evictions;Public and Subsidized Housing;Lucas, Quinton;Kansas City (Mo);United States
results.title: The Rent Revolution Is Coming
results.abstract: For the 44 million households who rent a home or apartment in the U.S., inflation keeps pushing costs higher and higher. Anger is rising too. It could be a breaking point.

media.caption: Tiana Caldwell, a co-founder and Board President of KC Tenants, outside the East Patrol Division Station in Kansas City after being arrested during the group's disruption of a city council vote on a new set of housing ordinances.
media.copyright: Barrett Emke for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Rumors and Misinformation;Censorship;Computers and the Internet;Elections;Politics and Government;Moraes, Alexandre de (1968- );Bolsonaro, Jair (1955- );Da Silva, Luiz Inacio Lula;Brazil
results.title: To Fight Lies, Brazil Gives One Man Power Over Online Speech
results.abstract: Brazilian authorities granted the country’s elections chief broad power to order the takedown of online content in a bid to combat soaring misinformation ahead of this month’s election.

media.caption: Alexandre de Moraes, a Supreme Court justice in Brazil who leads the nation’s electoral court, will now have broad power to order tech companies to remove content.
media.copyright: Dado Galdieri for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Buses;Automobiles;Airlines and Airplanes;Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum;DePaul University;Nashville (Tenn)
results.title: Goodbye Planes, Trains and Automobiles. Hello, Luxury Bus?
results.abstract: Start-up travel companies are hoping more Americans will embrace the concept of sleeper and luxury coaches. Just don’t call them buses.
org_facet: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum

media.caption: Passengers on the Napaway coach get comfortable as the bus leaves Washington, D.C., on Oct. 14 for an overnight trip to Nashville.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Children and Childhood;Putin, Vladimir V;Donetsk (Ukraine);Mariupol (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.title: Using Adoptions, Russia Turns Ukrainian Children Into Spoils of War
results.abstract: Thousands of Ukrainian children have been transferred to Russia. “I didn’t want to go,” one girl told The New York Times from a foster home near Moscow.

media.caption: A broken window at a hospital in March in Mariupol, Ukraine. Russian officials have made clear that their goal is to replace any childhood attachment to home with a love for Russia.

results.adx_keywords: Throat;Influenza;Colds;Vitamins;Coughs;Vitamin C;Immune System;Content Type: Service;Dietary Supplements and Herbal Remedies;Zinc;Alternative and Complementary Medicine;Turmeric (Spice);Research;Saunas and Sweat Lodges;Respiratory Diseases;Viruses;Herbs;Nose;Clinical Trials;Syrups;Humidifiers
results.byline: By Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Knvul Sheikh
results.title: Zinc? Honey? Ginger? What Actually Helps When You Have a Cold or the Flu?
results.abstract: Here’s what we know about some of the most popular remedies that show at least a little promise.

media.copyright: Molly Matalon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Theater;Theater (Broadway);Pop and Rock Music;Folk Music;Grammy Awards;Simon, Lucy;Simon, Carly;Simon, Joanna
results.title: Lucy Simon, Singer and Broadway Composer, Is Dead at 82
results.abstract: She and her sister Carly Simon were a folk duo in the 1960s. Years later, she wrote the Tony-nominated music for “The Secret Garden.”

media.caption: Lucy Simon in 1982. Her younger sister, Carly, became a best-selling pop star after their folk-duo days, and her older sister, Joanna, was an opera singer. Joanna died a day before Lucy’s death.

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;United States International Relations;Xi Jinping;Li Keqiang;Wang Huning (1955- );Wang Yang (1955- );Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China;Communist Party of China;China
results.byline: By Chris Buckley and Keith Bradsher
results.title: Xi Jinping Expands His Power, Elevating Loyalists, Forcing Out Moderates
results.abstract: A new lineup of the Communist Party elite will limit potential resistance to Mr. Xi’s agenda of bolstering security and expanding state sway over the economy.
org_facet: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China

media.caption: Xi Jinping with Premier Li Keqiang, center, and the Politburo Standing Committee member Wang Yang during the closing ceremony of the party congress. Both Mr. Li and Mr. Wang stepped down from the Central Committee, indicating that both are set to retire.

results.adx_keywords: Computer Chips;Factories and Manufacturing;International Trade and World Market;Embargoes and Sanctions;United States International Relations;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Commerce Department;China;United States
results.title: Biden Just Clobbered China’s Chip Industry
results.abstract: The latest American trade restrictions could significantly set back China’s semiconductor ambitions.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-health;internal-sub-only;your-feed-science;Vagina;Sex;Senses and Sensation;Women and Girls;Surgery and Surgeons;Plastic Surgery;Gynecology and Gynecologists;audio-neutral-informative
results.title: Half the World Has a Clitoris. Why Don’t Doctors Study It?
results.abstract: The organ is “completely ignored by pretty much everyone,” medical experts say, and that omission can be devastating to women’s sexual health.

results.adx_keywords: Subpoenas;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;Rumors and Misinformation;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);United States Politics and Government;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Trump, Donald J;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: Jan. 6 Panel Issues Subpoena to Trump, Setting Up Legal Battle Over Testimony
results.abstract: While the former president has suggested he might testify live before the committee, it was far more likely that the demand would lead to a legal fight.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump in Mesa, Ariz., last week. He released a lengthy, rambling letter that attacked the Jan. 6 committee’s work and reiterated false claims of widespread voting fraud but did not address whether he would comply with a subpoena.
media.copyright: Rebecca Noble for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Actors and Actresses;Content Type: Personal Profile;Comedy and Humor;Corden, James (1978- );McNally, Keith;Balthazar (Manhattan, NY, Restaurant)
results.title: James Corden Would Rather Not Talk About That Omelet
results.abstract: In an interview to promote his coming series, “Mammals,” the actor and late-night host dismissed a flap stemming from an Instagram post accusing him of boorish restaurant behavior. “I think it’s so silly,” he said.

media.caption: James Corden found himself the object of online scorn this week after the restaurateur Keith McNally accused him of abusive behavior toward wait staff.

results.adx_keywords: 401(k), 403(b) and 457 Plans;Pensions and Retirement Plans;Labor and Jobs;Savings;Retirement;Internal Revenue Service
results.title: 401(k) Contribution Limits Are Taking a Big Jump for 2023
results.abstract: The I.R.S. announced one of its largest increases in decades to caps on retirement contributions, allowing workers with access to the plans to save more.

media.caption: The Internal Revenue Service will raise the limit on what Americans can contribute to tax-advantaged retirement accounts next year by nearly 10 percent.
media.copyright: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
